column2: Overview  The quality of school education available to students from low-income communities across India is abysmal. Their chances of getting admitted to a college or building a career are much lower than their high-income peers, condemning them to a life without voice or choice.?iTeach was born to declare war on this status quo and create a level playing field for ALL children. We do this in Pune and Navi Mumbai by co-creating contextual school models with Municipal Corporations. We run 10 free and high-impact secondary schools and a college-to-career program for the most disadvantaged students. In 2024, with a staff of 250 members across 10 schools, we will serve 3000 students and 2000 alumni - giving students a fighting chance at college, career, and citizenship. We aim to grow to 30 schools and 10,000 students over the next five years.? Role Summary At iTeach, the School Principal is the CEO of the school. Along with the vice-principal and/or lead teachers, they are responsible for the management and development of their team (typically comprising twenty staff members), the holistic learning for each student, and the rapid progress of the entire school towards its vision.?The School Principal also leverages donors, government officials, program partners, and community leaders towards achieving their school goals. Lastly, the School Principal is a part of the iTeach Leadership Team and consequently plays a vital role in shaping the entire organizations strategy and growth. Responsibilities The responsibilities broadly fall into three categories: School Design, Team Management, and Stakeholder Investment. I. School Design Develop a three-year vision and strategy for your school Design the student week, unit, and year, keeping your school context and resources in mind Manage the schools operations, including systems for facility management, data recording and submission, and government permissions (in collaboration with our Network Team) Create and sustain a nurturing and high-performing staff and student culture Monitor all aspects of the schools day-to-day functioning and make progress towards the school vision, achieving better results with every passing year Systematize the documentation of best practices and resources to assist other schools Collaborate with the Finance Team and optimize the school budgets to equip the team best II. Team Management Get to know each staff member deeply, and co-create ambitious end-of-the-year goals Coach staff members in various aspects of their work (design, execution, and reflection) Review the progress of each staff member quarterly, and assist in identifying critical levers for improvement in the next quarter Define and build a healthy and high-performing staff culture, lead regular culture norming meetings to ensure alignment and refinement of your culture Collaborate with HR to ensure win-win career paths for staff members and their retention III. Stakeholder Investment Cultivate deep partnerships with local elected leaders and education officers to reach your school goals Work closely with the School Management Committee and parent body to leverage their support. Leverage our funding and volunteering partners to provide your staff and students with the resources they need to succeed Experience and Competencies Exceptional performance as a teacher for 3-4 years Overall work experience of 7+ years, with success in leading 10+ member teams? Proficient in project management Ability to lead a team independently and deliver strong results Preferred: Experience in coaching and development of teachers Salary - Salary is decided based on the candidate's education and work experience. Our compensation for this role lies between 10 to 14 Lakh Per Annum.
column11: School Management, Leadership Management, Teaching, Educational Administration

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. Make sure that all field activities run with our set standards. 2. Make sure that publicity matter reach to concern as per schedule. 3. Make sure that no field staff will be stuck up in there work due to unsolved problems.  4. To increase number of students attendance for library.  Preferred candidate profile   Required own motor cycle with license for local travelling Ready to travel Computer Literacy  Micro soft Teams Skill of drafting MS - Office  Perks and benefits   PF ESIC Mediclaim Bonus Education  BSW/MSW

Roles and Responsibilities:   Support MSIs Manager of Social Impact in executing and managing MSIs Social Impact initiatives, both in the US and in India.   Engage with existing NGO partners, monitor and audit their programs; provide insights based on ground-level observations.   Manage the employee-volunteering program in MSI Bangalore.   Support the end-to-end NGO partner onboarding process in coordination with the Manager of Social Impact.   Ensure compliance with our Social Impact norms, NGO funding utilization, and compile Quarterly, Annual Reports etc.   Identify new avenues for MSI India to give back to local communities.   Review grant proposals from potential grantees and provide feedback to the Manager.   Develop new partnerships with other foundations to explore areas of mutual interest and collaboration with the goal of increasing the scope of MSIs social impact.   Perform additional duties as required and or requested.   Qualification Requirements:  Bachelors degree (B.A.) in Social Work, Public or Business Administration, Public Health or a related field from a four-year college or two to four years of related experience and/or training.  Graduate degree in development sector or related field preferred; experience in philanthropy and/or non-profit organizations required.  Must have a knowledge of NGO sector with a focus on education, vocational training and public health.  Research and impact assessment experience and budget management is required.  Must be experienced Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and Excel and must be experienced in generating reports for the management.  Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies with ability to understand the basic data quality principles and practice.   Desired Skills:  Good communication and people skills.  Confidence and motivation to work toward targets.  Ability to work with c-suite executives. Ability to work well alone or within a team.  Demonstrated aptitude for problem solving.
column11: Corporate Social Responsibility, Social Work, NGO Management

column2: Job Title -  Project Manager Job location -  Ajmeri Gate, Delhi  If interested, please share your CV at  himanshu.sharma@magicbusindia.org MUST HAVE: Basic understanding about Golf and sports   Role:  To plan and execute the life skill program and Golf. Building and managing a team of Life Skill Educators and Community Coordinators. Providing strategic direction to the project and team at the district level working closely with Impact, training, and other functional areas. Building partnership and work in close collaboration with Government departments. Ensuring for delivery of training and orientation to all relevant stakeholders such as teachers and Principal. Responsible for successful implementation of programme in the district in coordination with the Human resources, Finance, Admin, and IT teams. Writing and submitting proposals as and when required in collaboration with other functions. Writing and submitting reports  narrative and financial working closely with regional office and other functional areas  Regular review and monitoring of progress and financial situation. Upholding the values of the organization at all levels of the intervention Accountable for delivery, outreach, and quality of program. Managing partnership with Golf partner agency and School. Partnership with Golf courses and insure the training of children about Golf. Specific Responsibilities: Mapping the Territory Responsible for mapping the territory of the districts/clusters and the communities and schools. Responsible for collaborating with the Area Team to establish Area guidelines and procedures. Managing Partnerships:  Liaison with Government, Local entities, communities, schools, government institutions / authorities Recruiting and Managing the Team Identifying Life Skills Educator and other leaders throughout the region. Making sure all team members comply with the company policies. Providing them with their job descriptions and send other information and updates including curriculum. Ensure efficient communication within the Team. Training the team Plan capacity building programs / trainings for the team members. Organize their training schedules immediately after joining. Program Management Preparing monthly, quarterly/ Annual Action Plan Follow ups on schedule / updates and checks on progress and performance of the team Overall managing and overseeing teams time, personnel, and resources. Reporting to DPM and Ops team and other functions as suggested. Monitoring and Evaluation  Records / Report Writing and data management Tracking and reviewing of the project Feedback and Review Budget & Financial Management Handle budget related issues Handle all accounts and finance matters from the program end Reporting expenses Desired Competencies:  Strong operational and team management skills that can be tailored to lead Magic Bus staff, on-ground partners, employers, and local agencies.  Sports background for 5-7 years having experience with project management, team management and partnership. Excellent organisational, planning and time management skills. Sharp focus on outcomes and how to shape interventions to achieve the maximum impact with youth on the programme. Build positive relationships with Stakeholders to achieve defined targets Can implement new processes and ways of working across an operational staff team. Can-do attitude and willingness to use own initiative to solve ground level problems Willingness to work extensively as and when required by internal functions and external stakeholders. Experience of Golf programs in school. Qualification and Experience  (essential unless otherwise stated): Masters in social work, Masters in Physical Education any Social Sciences or equivalent,  3 to 5 years??experience in social development sector and 3 years must have been in a similar managerial role. Must have working experience is Education/Sports sector. The candidate should possess a comprehensive background in GOLF and sports, showcasing their experience and knowledge in these areas.  Must be able to adhere to the highest ethical and moral standards and be able to display transparency. Good communications, facilitation and managerial skills are required Must have experience in report writing and MIS tracking Must have experience of managing donors/Govt officials in field. Fluent in the local language and Hindi. Additionally local dialect knowledge will be appreciated. Preference will be given to candidates having experience of working with School Development Good knowledge in Microsoft excel & word.
column11: Life Skills, Physical Education, Social Work, Training, Facilitation, NGO Management, Child Development, Mapping, Stakeholder Management

column2: Job Title: State Lead, Tribal TB  Location   Band/Grade 2A/2B  Department  Tribal TB Initiative under Tribal Health Collaborative  Degree of Travel  Medium to High (travel to the State Headquarters, National Research Institutes, Field visit to States and Districts) Purpose of Job To play a pivotal role at the national level for managing and coordinating activities and translate learnings of Tribal TB prevention & care from the districts and states to the national level across, liaise with the various Government departments under the aegis of the Tribal Health Collaborative for the fulfilment of the overall objective, support the government departments particularly Central TB division, Ministry of tribal affairs with the technical support including data intelligence & insights, coordinate with the THC in initiating/ organizing/ participating in national level events on Tribal TB, build capacities of the State and District level teams to engage with respective stake holders, provide strategic input for Communitization , State Capacity Building and Innovations to the key personnel of the project  Chief of Party, Technical Advisor, Research Monitoring Learning Evaluation Lead.    Key stakeholders External Internal Government Central TB Division and its consulting organizations like WHO, Union etc Ministry of Tribal Affairs USAID  Related organisations as and when required Central and State operations teams Tribal Health Collaborative Other programs like the USAID Momentum Grant All Departments Reporting structure Role directly reports to Positions that report into this role  Regional/Operational Lead State program coordinator, State M&E officer, District Program Officer and District Program Coordinator  Essential Qualifications MSW /MA Social Work/ M.Sc Graduate/ Post-graduate in relevant field of health and life sciences  Essential Experience At least 8-10 years experience in a reputed international/ large non-governmental organization/government organization Experience in managing government stake holders at state-level Experience in the TB program would be preferable Experience in state-level work desirable Essential Skills Ability to coordinate with multiple government departments and state level stake holders Ability to share knowledge and learnings across varied forums at state-level and to National team Ability to identify best practices and suggest innovations Ability to train and hand-hold he state and field teams  Ability to manage a team of 20 or more  Additional preference Candidates from tribal communities will be given preference TB survivors will be given preference Women candidates will be given preference Key Roles/Responsibilities: Operations Oversee the implementation of activities in all identified districts as per the work plan through the district teams Support District teams for monthly and quarterly activity and tour plans  Ensure the activities are executed as per the plan and desired deliverables achieved Support district teams in stake holder management at their level. 2.Stakeholder Management State NTEP State Tribal Welfare dept State officer of any other relevant departments-PDS, WCD, SRLM, RDPR, Industries, Mining State NHM TRI, NGOs and partners Represent Piramal Swasthya/ Tribal TB initiative at state and public forums 3.Technical Support to State NTEP and NHM Support state and district NTEP in preparation of TB Free District Action Plans Gap analysis and solutioning Health system strengthening 4.Recording, Reporting, Supervision, Review State Project data District-level data Onward sharing with central team and state NTEP Regular online review of District wise Tribal TB initiative activities Identify gaps/ challenges/ sub-optimal performances and flag them with district teams Provide constructive feedback on a regular basis Onsite visits to districts Progress review and implementation of TB Free District action plans 5. Oversee the following through the District Program Officer and District Program Coordinator Coordinate staff schedules, training, and onboarding HR and Admin management of staff Ensure compliances with all policies
column11: State Level, Tribal TB, Team Management, Social Work, Coordination, Data Management, state Capacity Building, Support District, Social Service, Program Coordinator, Tuberculosis, Community Development, NTEP, Stakeholder Management
